Class CardViewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CardViewerHand

    public class CardViewer
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    CS252 Object-Oriented Programming
    CardViewer Class. A big part of the GUI, represents a collection of cards.
    Author:
    George Kokiadis csd3962@csd.uoc.gr
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getButtonStatus()
      Get Button Status (active/inactive)
      protected void performAction()
      Perform the action dictated by the button
      Pre Conditions : Depends on the area the cardviewer represents.
      void setButtonStatus(boolean s)
      Sets the button status.
      void toggleButtonStatus()
      Toggle to Deactivate or activate the action Button, so the user can not click it when they are not supposed to.
      void update(int[] numbers)
      Update the contents of the cardViewer
      Pre Conditions : numbers[] is of size 8 and its contents are bigger than 0
      Post Conditions : View numbers are changed to the given numbers

      • update

        public void update(int[] numbers)
        Update the contents of the cardViewer
        Pre Conditions : numbers[] is of size 8 and its contents are bigger than 0
        Post Conditions : View numbers are changed to the given numbers
        Parameters:
        numbers - Number of cards in each stack (red, green etc)
